title: 103_hr3553
content: The Act is titled the "East Saint Louis Jefferson National Expansion Memorial Architectural Design Competition Act" and it establishes an architectural design competition. Establishment of a 7-member commission appointed by the Secretary of the Interior for the East Saint Louis Jefferson National Expansion Memorial Architectural Design Competition Act. Members include representatives from Saint Louis, Missouri, East Saint Louis, Illinois, Department of the Interior, and architectural design experts. Commission to be appointed within 90 days. The commission, established for the East Saint Louis Jefferson National Expansion Memorial Architectural Design Competition Act, will have members appointed for life. Vacancies will be filled in the same manner as the original appointment. The commission will select a Chairperson and Vice Chairperson from among its members and will hold meetings as scheduled by the Chairperson. The commission members serve without compensation but are allowed travel expenses. The Chairperson can appoint an executive director and additional staff as needed. The Chairperson appoints an executive director for the commission, whose compensation can be determined without following certain regulations. Federal Government employees can be detailed to the commission without reimbursement. The Chairperson may procure temporary and intermittent services under section 3109(b) of title 5, United States Code, at rates not exceeding the daily equivalent of the annual rate of basic pay for level V of the Executive Schedule. The commission has the power to request necessary information from Federal agencies to carry out its duties. The commission may use the United States mails for postal services and accept gifts. They will conduct an architectural competition for a museum in East Saint Louis and conduct a study. The commission will conduct a study on funding mechanisms for the museum and submit a report with recommendations to the President and Congress within 18 months of the Act's enactment. Authorization of appropriations for this Act is set at $300,000.
